banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Could Moby Dick prevent the next financial crisis?
videoData.socialTitle: Could Moby Dick prevent the next financial crisis?

nodes.whoTheyAre: Suzanne Case is a senior vice president at State Street, managing a global operations team that delivers solutions across a breadth of custody, banking and regulatory disciplines. A champion for inclusion, Case helps remove barriers to professional development through coaching, mentoring and company-wide executive sponsorships. She was recognized with State Street’s 2014 Black Professionals Group “Ambassador for Diversity and Inclusion Award” for outstanding leadership.

videoData.description: Suzanne Case, a self-identified "bibliobanker," believes that literature's power to foster empathy can change the future of the finance industry. Case argues that insensitivity to the human condition was a key factor in the 2008 recession and shows how a daily dose of Herman Melville or Charles Dickens could be the remedy.
videoData.socialDescription: Suzanne Case, a self-identified "bibliobanker," believes that literature's power to foster empathy can change the future of the finance industry. Case argues that insensitivity to the human condition was a key factor in the 2008 recession and shows how a daily dose of Herman Melville or Charles Dickens could be the remedy.
